abstract: East Orange, NJ, has received $6 million in bond financing to renovate East Orange Golf Course, which covers more than 150 acres of extremely valuable real estate; course, which has been in decline for some time, was closed for year after operating hundreds of thousands of dollars in the red.
lead_paragraph: One of the best assets of East Orange, N.J., was shaggy and operating in the red, but leaders recognized its business potential given its proximity to Short Hills, a lush suburb.

headline.main: A Struggling City Renovates Its Golf Course, Envisioning More Green
headline.print_headline: A City Rising From the Rough

snippet: One of the best assets of East Orange, N.J., was shaggy and operating in the red, but leaders recognized its business potential given its proximity to Short Hills, a lush suburb.
